content.description: The first problem I climbed out here and one of the best problems so far, even being a drop off. Start right hand in the scoop, left on the crimp. Fire to the pinch. a few more moves will take you to the jug above the overhang. Drop. Kind of left right and center variations to get to the finish, all around the same grade. This would be a four star boulder problem if the to-be top out wasn't certain death by mud. Unfortunately I am discovering this to often be wet.
content.location: This problem marks the beginning of the solitaire area, and lies on the left side on the cliff.

content.description: Start right hand on the slopey arete pinch at mid height, left way down low on the in cut left facing crimp. Top out, a fun one.
content.location: The arete just right of Hayduke lives.

content.description: Try to climb the huge awesome overhang. Supurb movement. Top outs loose mud, but a possible escape ledge exists..
content.location: On the second section of cliff around the corner from the grateful fin. 50 yards left of The Fool's Progress, left of the crack/ break in the middle of the cliff.

content.description: No idea about the grade.. Start low on two pockets in the middle of the wall, climb up then left, topping out the center of the prow. Scoot right asap on the top out to avoid mud and leaves. Walk off right.
As fun as it looks. left hand in pocket under the rail, right in the undercling pinch. Grab the jug on the top to finish, or test your odds with the mud and leaves that lie above...
content.location: Far right end of the solitaire area.

content.description: Start on the kind of sandy block in the back of the overhang. The rock quality immediately gets better. Make a big move to the lip, and a few more moves to top out onto the ledge. Also not sure about the grade of this one.
content.protection: Pads. Downclimb and drop from the ledge.
content.location: This lies about half way between the Grateful Fin and the Solitaire area. Spot the tiered roof section of cliff line, this problem lies on the rightish side of it.

content.description: The Shawnee Solitaire area offers the best in terms of aesthetic lines and quality hard movement.
